items.content: The former Brazilian president is suspected of damaging an ankle bracelet as part of an alleged escape plan.

items.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro arrested days before starting 27-year prison sentence
items.standfirst: Brazil's federal police arrested former President Jair Bolsonaro, who was convicted of leading a coup attempt.
items.content: Brazil's federal police arrested former President Jair Bolsonaro, who was convicted of leading a coup attempt.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro arrested after tampering with ankle tag ‘out of curiosity’
items.standfirst: Brazilian ex-president says he used soldering iron on device and is now in custody over fears he was going to abscondBrazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he tried to damage his electronic ankle monitor “out of curiosity” after he was arrested at his villa owing to suspicions he was poised to abscond.In a video released by the supreme court, Bolsonaro – who was recently sentenced to 27 years in prison for masterminding a military coup – can be heard admitting to a security official that he had used a soldering iron to tamper with the black tag. Continue reading...
items.content: Brazilian ex-president says he used soldering iron on device and is now in custody over fears he was going to abscondBrazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he tried to damage his electronic ankle monitor “out of curiosity” after he was arrested at his villa owing to suspicions he was poised to abscond.In a video released by the supreme court, Bolsonaro – who was recently sentenced to 27 years in prison for masterminding a military coup – can be heard admitting to a security official that he had used a soldering iron to tamper with the black tag. Continue reading...

items.title: Bolsonaro arrested over alleged plot to escape and avoid 27-year prison term in Brazil
items.standfirst: Brazil's federal police on Saturday arrested former president Jair Bolsonaro over suspicion he was plotting to escape and avoid starting a 27-year prison sentence for leading a coup attempt.
items.content: Brazil's federal police on Saturday arrested former president Jair Bolsonaro over suspicion he was plotting to escape and avoid starting a 27-year prison sentence for leading a coup attempt.

items.title: Brazilian court orders preemptive arrest of former president Jair Bolsonaro
items.standfirst: Jair Bolsonaro has been taken into custody after being deemed a “concrete flight risk” while under house arrest. The former Brazilian president was convicted in September of plotting a military coup and sentenced to more than 27 years in prison, though he has remained under house arrest while his appeals proceed. Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes said the decision to detain the 70-year-old was a preventive measure prompted by “new facts” that had recently emerged. France24 International Affairs Editor Philip Turle shares his insights.
items.content: Jair Bolsonaro has been taken into custody after being deemed a “concrete flight risk” while under house arrest. The former Brazilian president was convicted in September of plotting a military coup and sentenced to more than 27 years in prison, though he has remained under house arrest while his appeals proceed. Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes said the decision to detain the 70-year-old was a preventive measure prompted by “new facts” that had recently emerged. France24 International Affairs Editor Philip Turle shares his insights.

items.title: Former president Jair Bolsonaro arrested due to "flight risk"
items.standfirst: Federal police detained Brazil’s ex-president Jair Bolsonaro on Saturday after a Supreme Court judge deemed the far-right firebrand a "high flight risk". The arrest comes just days before Bolsonaro is due to begin a 27-year prison term for leading a botched coup attempt. Caroline Baum reports.
items.content: Federal police detained Brazil’s ex-president Jair Bolsonaro on Saturday after a Supreme Court judge deemed the far-right firebrand a "high flight risk". The arrest comes just days before Bolsonaro is due to begin a 27-year prison term for leading a botched coup attempt. Caroline Baum reports.

items.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro arrested for allegedly plotting escape ahead of prison term
items.standfirst: Brazil's Supreme Court ordered the arrest of Jair Bolsonaro, with a judge claiming the former president was intent on escaping as he was set to begin his prison sentence for leading a coup attempt.
items.content: Brazil's Supreme Court ordered the arrest of Jair Bolsonaro, with a judge claiming the former president was intent on escaping as he was set to begin his prison sentence for leading a coup attempt.(Image credit: Luis Nova)

items.title: Ex-Brazil president 'tried to open ankle monitor' with soldering iron in 'escape attempt'
items.standfirst: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro has been arrested after allegedly trying to open his ankle monitor with a soldering iron in a bid to flee and avoid a jail term, according to court documents.
items.content: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro has been arrested after allegedly trying to open his ankle monitor with a soldering iron in a bid to flee and avoid a jail term, according to court documents.

items.title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro arrested as flight risk days before start of prison term
items.standfirst: The former president is taken in Brasilia due to alleged escape plan before prison time for leading a coup attempt.
items.content: The former president is taken in Brasilia due to alleged escape plan before prison time for leading a coup attempt.

items.title: Brazil’s former president Jair Bolsonaro arrested, lawyer says
items.standfirst: Federal police on Saturday arrested Brazil’s ex-president Jair Bolsonaro, who was sentenced to jail earlier this year over a botched coup attempt, his lawyer confirmed. The arrest comes a week after a court rejected Bolsonaro's appeal of his 27-year prison term. FRANCE 24 correspondent Tim Vickery reports the latest from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
items.content: Federal police on Saturday arrested Brazil’s ex-president Jair Bolsonaro, who was sentenced to jail earlier this year over a botched coup attempt, his lawyer confirmed. The arrest comes a week after a court rejected Bolsonaro's appeal of his 27-year prison term. FRANCE 24 correspondent Tim Vickery reports the latest from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

items.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro detained for attempting to break ankle bracelet and escape
items.standfirst: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro, under house arrest while he appeals a conviction for a foiled coup attempt, was detained Saturday after the Supreme Court deemed him a high flight risk. The court said the far-right leader had tried to disable his ankle monitor in order to escape.
items.content: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro, under house arrest while he appeals a conviction for a foiled coup attempt, was detained Saturday after the Supreme Court deemed him a high flight risk. The court said the far-right leader had tried to disable his ankle monitor in order to escape.

ai_summary: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro was arrested by federal police on Saturday.
He is suspected of planning to escape and avoid a 27-year prison sentence.
Bolsonaro was convicted of leading a coup attempt in September.
The arrest was a preventive measure due to "new facts" that emerged.
Bolsonaro reportedly tampered with his electronic ankle monitor using a soldering iron.

items.title: Trump says US plan to end Ukraine war not 'final offer' for Kyiv

items.content: US President Donald Trump says the plan is not his "final offer" for Kyiv, and security officials are set to meet in Geneva on Sunday.

items.title: Western leaders at G20 say US peace plan for Ukraine ‘will require work’
items.standfirst: European leaders say Washington’s proposal needs major changes, as Macron warns G20 risks losing relevanceWestern leaders have said the US peace plan for ending the war in Ukraine “will require additional work” at the G20 summit in Johannesburg, which Donald Trump boycotted.The draft plan, which was leaked this week, endorsed some of Russia’s demands, such as handing over areas of Ukraine’s eastern Donbas region, limiting its military, and relinquishing its ambitions to join Nato. Washington has given Kyiv a deadline of Thursday to respond. Continue reading...
items.content: European leaders say Washington’s proposal needs major changes, as Macron warns G20 risks losing relevanceWestern leaders have said the US peace plan for ending the war in Ukraine “will require additional work” at the G20 summit in Johannesburg, which Donald Trump boycotted.The draft plan, which was leaked this week, endorsed some of Russia’s demands, such as handing over areas of Ukraine’s eastern Donbas region, limiting its military, and relinquishing its ambitions to join Nato. Washington has given Kyiv a deadline of Thursday to respond. Continue reading...

Kyiv will seek to push back against provisions that mirror some of Moscow’s toughest demands, while European leaders said the US plan "is a basis which will require additional work".

items.title: White House urges Ukraine to accept peace plan as Zelenskyy weighs repercussions
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials

items.standfirst: Some Republicans offered congresswoman plaudits, but AOC was scathing in her dismissal of her frequent sparring partnerMarjorie Taylor Greene’s surprise resignation from Congress late on Friday, saying she refused to be a “battered wife” following her public fallout with Donald Trump, has been slammed by Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, the Democratic congresswoman and Greene’s frequent sparring partner.“She’s carefully timing her departure just 1-2 days after her pension kicks in,” Ocasio-Cortez said in a statement on her Instagram account, and criticized her voting record on healthcare. items.title: Trump ally Marjorie Taylor Greene to quit Congress after Epstein files feud
items.standfirst: A falling out with the US president erupted amid her relentless calls to release documents on the late paedophile.
items.content: A falling out with the US president erupted amid her relentless calls to release documents on the late paedophile.

items.title: MAGA figure Marjorie Taylor Greene to quit US Congress after split with Trump
items.standfirst: US Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene, citing her refusal to be a “battered wife”, announced Friday that she is resigning from the House of Representatives following a dramatic fallout with President Donald Trump. The move marks a surprising reversal for the Georgia Republican, who was once one of Trump’s closest allies and a vocal supporter of his “America First” agenda, but whose relationship with the former president deteriorated in recent months amid disputes over the release of government files related to Jeffrey Epstein and other issues. Gabrielle Nadler and Alexandra Quarini report.
items.content: US Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene, citing her refusal to be a “battered wife”, announced Friday that she is resigning from the House of Representatives following a dramatic fallout with President Donald Trump. The move marks a surprising reversal for the Georgia Republican, who was once one of Trump’s closest allies and a vocal supporter of his “America First” agenda, but whose relationship with the former president deteriorated in recent months amid disputes over the release of government files related to Jeffrey Epstein and other issues. Gabrielle Nadler and Alexandra Quarini report.

items.title: How Marjorie Taylor Greene went from a top Trump ally to choosing to resign
items.standfirst: Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene was one of President Trump's most outspoken supporters. But she is planning to leave office following a growing rift with the president.
items.content: Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene was one of President Trump's most outspoken supporters. But she is planning to leave office following a growing rift with the president.(Image credit: DANIEL HEUER)

items.title: After break with Trump, Marjorie Taylor Greene will resign
items.standfirst: Republican Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, an "America First" conservative who has clashed with President Trump and her party, said Friday she would resign from Congress Jan. 5, 2026.
items.content: Republican Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, an "America First" conservative who has clashed with President Trump and her party, said Friday she would resign from Congress Jan. 5, 2026.(Image credit: Daniel Heuer)

ai_summary: Marjorie Taylor Greene announced her resignation from Congress on Friday.

clusters.title: End of fossil fuel era inches closer as Cop30 deal agreed after bitter standoff
clusters.neutral_headline: COP30 Climate Talks Conclude Without Fossil Fuel Phase-Out

items.title: End of fossil fuel era inches closer as Cop30 deal agreed after bitter standoff
items.standfirst: Wealthy countries should triple funds for countries to tackle climate impacts, but deforestation and critical minerals blocked from final dealThe world edged a small step closer to the end of the fossil fuel era on Saturday, but not by nearly enough to stave off the ravages of climate breakdown.Countries meeting in Brazil for two weeks could manage only a voluntary agreement to begin discussions on a roadmap to an eventual phase-out of fossil fuels, and they achieved this incremental progress only in the teeth of implacable opposition from oil-producing countries. Continue reading...
items.content: Wealthy countries should triple funds for countries to tackle climate impacts, but deforestation and critical minerals blocked from final dealThe world edged a small step closer to the end of the fossil fuel era on Saturday, but not by nearly enough to stave off the ravages of climate breakdown.Countries meeting in Brazil for two weeks could manage only a voluntary agreement to begin discussions on a roadmap to an eventual phase-out of fossil fuels, and they achieved this incremental progress only in the teeth of implacable opposition from oil-producing countries. Continue reading...

items.content: Dozens of countries had called for a clear "roadmap" to transition away from the use of coal, oil and natural gas. The U.S. did not participate in the negotiations.(Image credit: Andre Penner)

items.title: COP30 climate talks end in Brazil without roadmap to phase out fossil fuels
items.standfirst: United Nations climate talks in Brazil reached a subdued agreement Saturday to deliver more money to countries hit hardest by climate change to help them adapt to extreme weather’s wrath. But the agreement doesn’t include an explicit detailed map to phase out fossil fuels or strengthen inadequate…
items.content: United Nations climate talks in Brazil reached a subdued agreement Saturday to deliver more money to countries hit hardest by climate change to help them adapt to extreme weather’s wrath. But the agreement doesn’t include an explicit detailed map to phase out fossil fuels or strengthen inadequate…

items.title: COP30 summit in Brazil adopts climate deal – after omitting calls to phase out fossil fuels
items.standfirst: The COP30 climate talks in Brazil on Saturday culminated in a final agreement which dropped any explicit call to phase out fossil fuels, despite calls to do so from the EU and dozens of nations. The text showed countries had agreed to accelerate climate action, examine trade barriers linked to it and triple funding for developing nations facing extreme weather.
items.content: The COP30 climate talks in Brazil on Saturday culminated in a final agreement which dropped any explicit call to phase out fossil fuels, despite calls to do so from the EU and dozens of nations. The text showed countries had agreed to accelerate climate action, examine trade barriers linked to it and triple funding for developing nations facing extreme weather.

ai_summary: COP30 climate talks in Brazil ended without a roadmap to phase out fossil fuels.
The agreement includes more money for countries hit by climate change.
The deal lacks explicit mention of phasing out fossil fuels.
Dozens of countries had called for a clear transition away from fossil fuels.
The US did not participate in the negotiations.

items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump and New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani met on Friday after weeks of trading barbs.
items.content: US President Donald Trump and New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani met on Friday after weeks of trading barbs.

items.title: Trump praises New York mayor-elect Mamdani at warm White House meeting
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump and New York's incoming progressive mayor Zohran Mamdani were all smiles at a White House meeting on Friday, promising to set aside months of bitter feuding and cooperate on the city's future. Trump, who had previously labelled Mamdani a "100% Communist Lunatic", said the incoming mayor would do a "great job" leading the nation's biggest city. Morgan Ayre reports.
items.content: US President Donald Trump and New York's incoming progressive mayor Zohran Mamdani were all smiles at a White House meeting on Friday, promising to set aside months of bitter feuding and cooperate on the city's future. Trump, who had previously labelled Mamdani a "100% Communist Lunatic", said the incoming mayor would do a "great job" leading the nation's biggest city. Morgan Ayre reports.

ai_summary: Donald Trump met with New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani.
Trump praised Mamdani, despite previous attacks.
Mamdani called Trump a "fascist" during the meeting.
Mamdani said Israel is committing genocide in Gaza.
Socialists are divided on the meeting's positive tone.

clusters.title: More than 300 schoolchildren abducted in attack on Catholic school in Nigeria, authorities say

items.title: More than 300 schoolchildren abducted in attack on Catholic school in Nigeria, authorities say
items.standfirst: A total of 303 schoolchildren and 12 teachers were abducted by gunmen during an attack on St. Mary’s School, a Catholic institution in north-central Nigeria’s Niger state, the Christian Association of Nigeria said Saturday, updating an earlier tally of 215 schoolchildren.
items.content: A total of 303 schoolchildren and 12 teachers were abducted by gunmen during an attack on St. Mary’s School, a Catholic institution in north-central Nigeria’s Niger state, the Christian Association of Nigeria said Saturday, updating an earlier tally of 215 schoolchildren.

items.title: More than 300 children were abducted in an attack on a Catholic school in Nigeria
items.standfirst: A total of 303 schoolchildren and 12 teachers were abducted by gunmen during an attack on St. Mary's School, a Catholic institution in north-central Nigeria's Niger state, the Christian Association of Nigeria said.
items.content: A total of 303 schoolchildren and 12 teachers were abducted by gunmen during an attack on St. Mary's School, a Catholic institution in north-central Nigeria's Niger state, the Christian Association of Nigeria said.(Image credit: Christian Association of Nigeria)

items.title: Attacks in Nigeria: More than 300 students and staff kidnapped in Niger state raid
items.standfirst: A total of 303 students and 12 teachers were kidnapped by armed men during an attack on St. Mary’s School, a Catholic institution in Niger state in north-central Nigeria, the Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) said Saturday. The updated figure revises an earlier count of 215 students. The numbers were adjusted “after a verification exercise and a final headcount”, according to a statement from Most Rev. Bulus Dauwa Yohanna, chairman of CAN’s Niger state chapter, who visited the school on Friday. Morgan Ayre reports.
items.content: A total of 303 students and 12 teachers were kidnapped by armed men during an attack on St. Mary’s School, a Catholic institution in Niger state in north-central Nigeria, the Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) said Saturday. The updated figure revises an earlier count of 215 students. The numbers were adjusted “after a verification exercise and a final headcount”, according to a statement from Most Rev. Bulus Dauwa Yohanna, chairman of CAN’s Niger state chapter, who visited the school on Friday. Morgan Ayre reports.

items.title: Nigeria reels after 215 children taken in second mass school abduction in a week
items.standfirst: Twelve teachers also kidnapped from Catholic school amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted 215 schoolchildren and 12 teachers from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. Continue reading...
items.content: Twelve teachers also kidnapped from Catholic school amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted 215 schoolchildren and 12 teachers from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Gunmen abducted over 300 schoolchildren and teachers in Nigeria.
The attack occurred at St. Mary's School, a Catholic institution.
The Christian Association of Nigeria provided the updated figures.
This is the second mass school abduction in Nigeria in a week.
Donald Trump threatened to intervene over "Christian genocide".

items.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of JFK, announces terminal cancer diagnosis
items.standfirst: Journalist, daughter of Caroline Kennedy and Edwin Schlossberg, reveals she has acute myeloid leukemiaTatiana Schlossberg, a journalist and the granddaughter of John F Kennedy, disclosed on Saturday that she has been diagnosed with terminal cancer, saying her doctor informed her that she has less than a year left to live.The environmental writer also addressed her cousin, Robert F Kennedy Jr, criticizing the influence his policies as secretary of health and human services have had on her experience with the illness. clusters.title: 11 injured after grizzly bear attacks group of elementary school students
clusters.neutral_headline: Grizzly Bear Attacks Schoolchildren in Canada

items.title: 11 injured after grizzly bear attacks group of elementary school students
items.standfirst: A grizzly bear attacked a group of elementary school students and their teachers in British Columbia, injuring 11 people. Authorities say teachers were able to use bear spray and bear bangers to scare off the grizzly. NBC News’ Morgan Chesky reports.
items.content: A grizzly bear attacked a group of elementary school students and their teachers in British Columbia, injuring 11 people. Authorities say teachers were able to use bear spray and bear bangers to scare off the grizzly. NBC News’ Morgan Chesky reports.

items.title: Eleven injured after grizzly bear attacks schoolchildren and teachers in Canada
items.standfirst: Two critically hurt after attack on walking trail in British Columbia as police and conservation officers search for bearEleven people were injured, two of them critically, when a grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers on a walking trail in British Columbia, Canada.The attack happened on Thursday in Bella Coola, 435 miles (700km) north-west of Vancouver. The Nuxalk Nation said the “aggressive bear” remained on the loose and police and conservation officers were on the scene. Continue reading...
items.content: Two critically hurt after attack on walking trail in British Columbia as police and conservation officers search for bearEleven people were injured, two of them critically, when a grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers on a walking trail in British Columbia, Canada.The attack happened on Thursday in Bella Coola, 435 miles (700km) north-west of Vancouver. The Nuxalk Nation said the “aggressive bear” remained on the loose and police and conservation officers were on the scene. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump to end temporary protected status for Somali immigrants in Minnesota
items.standfirst: Move could affect hundreds of Somalis who fled civil war in their home countryDonald Trump said on Friday night that he’s “immediately” terminating temporary legal protections for Somali migrants living in Minnesota, further targeting a program seeking to limit deportations that his administration has already repeatedly sought to weaken.Minnesota has the nation’s largest Somali community. Many fled the long civil war in the east African country and were drawn to the state’s welcoming social programs. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Leaders meet for first Africa-hosted G20
clusters.neutral_headline: G20 Summit in Africa Addresses Global Issues

items.title: Leaders meet for first Africa-hosted G20
items.standfirst: The final document of the Group of 20 summit in South Africa pledges to work toward resolving armed conflicts and easing the burdens on developing nations. Convened on Saturday as the first G20 meeting held on the African continent, the two-day summit set an ambitious agenda to tackle longstanding issues affecting the world’s poorest countries, despite a boycott by the United States. Director of Anglo-American La wat Cergy-Paris University and West African politics expert, Douglas Yates, shares his insights.
items.content: The final document of the Group of 20 summit in South Africa pledges to work toward resolving armed conflicts and easing the burdens on developing nations. Convened on Saturday as the first G20 meeting held on the African continent, the two-day summit set an ambitious agenda to tackle longstanding issues affecting the world’s poorest countries, despite a boycott by the United States. Director of Anglo-American La wat Cergy-Paris University and West African politics expert, Douglas Yates, shares his insights.

items.title: Africa's first G20 summit opens with an ambitious agenda and a U.S. boycott
items.standfirst: The first Group of 20 summit to be held in Africa opened on Saturday with an ambitious agenda to make progress on solving some of the long-standing problems that have afflicted the world's poorest nations
items.content: The first Group of 20 summit to be held in Africa opened on Saturday with an ambitious agenda to make progress on solving some of the long-standing problems that have afflicted the world's poorest nations

ai_summary: The G20 summit in South Africa focused on resolving conflicts and aiding developing nations.

The United States boycotted the two-day summit.

Experts discussed the summit's significance and the issues addressed.
